newsitem.title: COSTA RICA: Costa Rica plans to launch $500 mln bond.
newsitem.headline: Costa Rica plans to launch $500 mln bond.

text.p: Costa Rican legislators have approved plans for the government to issue $500 million in a two-tranche bond offer, government spokesman Marco Antonio Vargas told reporters on Friday.
The government plans to place $200 million before May 7 1998, and later place the remaining $300 million.
Vargas said the partial dollarization of the country's debt will alleviate a heavy internal debt, saving the country up to one billion colones (some $4.5 million) annually.
"In addition, (the bond) will reduce pressure on interest rates and help boost the country's economic recovery," he added.

Interest payment on the internal debt alone, considered by the government one of the nation's most serious problems, accounts for between 28 and 36 percent of the budget, the Finance Ministry has said.
